# Chord: Dominant 7#5 in C# (Shape: C)

## Description
The Dominant 7#5 chord in C# (C shape) consists of the notes C#-E-G#-B. This chord has a sharp fifth (G#) and a dominant 7th (B), creating a crunchy and dissonant sound that adds tension to a progression. It is commonly used in jazz and fusion styles to create a sense of harmonic tension and provide a colorful and unexpected flavor within a musical context.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root: C# (1)
- Major Third: E (3)
- Sharp Fifth: G# (#5)
- Dominant Seventh: B (b7)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Dominant 7#5 chord is often utilized in jazz, fusion, and other contemporary styles of music. Its unique combination of intervals brings a sense of tension and unpredictability to a chord progression, allowing for more adventurous and colorful harmonic choices. When used in these genres, the Dominant 7#5 chord adds a modern and sophisticated flavor to the music, helping to create a dynamic and engaging listening experience.
